[File: peer-monitoring-service/client/src/logging.rs] [Struct: LogSchema] [PII Leakage] Can the 'request_id' field be used to correlate and track individual peers across log exports, violating privacy expectations for peer monitoring data? (Low)

[File: peer-monitoring-service/client/src/logging.rs] [Enum: LogEntry] [Misuse] Does the LatencyPing entry adequately distinguish between different ping types (initial, retry, health check), potentially conflating security-relevant latency measurements? (Medium)

[File: peer-monitoring-service/client/src/logging.rs] [Struct: LogSchema] [DoS] Can attackers trigger rapid PeerPingError or InvalidResponse events to cause excessive log I/O, degrading validator node performance during consensus-critical operations? (Medium)

[File: peer-monitoring-service/client/src/logging.rs] [Enum: LogEvent] [DoS] Does the LogAllPeerStates event cause expensive serialization of all peer state when triggered, allowing attackers to degrade performance by forcing frequent state logging? (Medium)

[File: peer-monitoring-service/client/src/logging.rs] [Enum: LogEvent] [Missing Feature] Is there no event type for detecting Byzantine behavior or protocol violations, causing such events to be logged under generic UnexpectedErrorEncountered? (High)

[File: peer-monitoring-service/client/src/logging.rs] [Struct: LogSchema] [Audit Trail] Can logs be retroactively modified or deleted without detection due to lack of append-only guarantees or tamper-evident logging mechanisms? (Medium)
